description: Indicates the current status of the target manager.
interpretation: Shows whether the target manager process is up or down. A value of Running (1) means the manager is operational; Not Running (0) indicates it is down, so no API calls or ticket operations will be performed. Graphs use the numeric codes while the UI shows the text values.

description: Indicates the total number of API calls made from the eG manager for this organization to the TT system during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Represents the overall API traffic volume to the ticketing system in the latest interval and is useful for understanding load and sizing limits.

description: Indicates the percentage of API calls succeeded for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: A higher value indicates a healthy integration. A low percentage suggests frequent API failures, which can lead to missing or inconsistent tickets in the TT system.

description: Indicates the average time taken to receive response from the TT system.
interpretation: If this average rises above normal, it points to latency issues between the eG manager and the TT system. Such slowness can delay creating, updating, or closing tickets and may cause alarms to be missed.

description: Indicates the average time taken by the TT system to create the ticket for this organization.
interpretation: Reflects how quickly new tickets are created. Higher values show creation latency in the end‑to‑end flow and may delay incident handling.

description: Indicates the average time taken by the TT system to update the ticket for this organization.
interpretation: Shows how long ticket updates take to be applied. Large values indicate latency that can slow synchronization of ticket status between systems.

description: Indicates the average time taken by the TT system to close the ticket for this organization.
interpretation: Measures the delay in reflecting ticket closure. High values indicate slow close operations that may cause dashboards or reports to show outdated open incidents.

description: Indicates the number of API calls succeeded for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Together with NoCallsFailed and TotalCallsCount, this helps you quantify overall reliability of API interactions with the TT system.

description: Indicates the number of API calls failed for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: A non‑trivial value indicates integration problems such as connectivity issues, authentication errors, or TT‑side failures, all of which can cause missing or incomplete tickets.

description: Indicates the number of tickets created for this organization in the last measurement period.
interpretation: Shows the volume of new incidents or requests raised via the integration in the latest interval and is useful for workload and trend analysis.

description: Indicates the number of tickets updated for this organization in the last measurement period.
interpretation: Reflects how many existing tickets had their details or status changed, indicating the level of ongoing ticket activity.

description: Indicates the number of tickets closed for this organization in the last measurement period.
interpretation: Represents the volume of incidents resolved or completed; comparing this to TicketsCreated helps assess backlog growth or reduction.

description: Indicates the number of high priority tickets created for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Shows the inflow of critical issues. Sudden spikes may indicate major incidents or systemic problems requiring urgent attention.

description: Indicates the number of medium priority tickets created for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Represents the volume of medium‑severity issues raised and contributes to understanding the overall mix of ticket priorities.

description: Indicates the number of low priority tickets created for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Shows how many lower‑impact issues were logged. A high number may suggest opportunities for automation or policy changes to reduce noise.

description: Indicates the number of high priority tickets updated for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Indicates ongoing work and status changes on critical incidents. Continuous updates are expected for actively managed high‑priority issues.

description: Indicates the number of medium priority tickets updated for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Shows how frequently medium‑priority tickets are being worked on or progressed during the interval.

description: Indicates the number of low priority tickets updated for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Reflects ongoing activity on low‑priority items and can help ensure such tickets are not forgotten despite their lower urgency.

description: Indicates the number of retried API calls for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Shows how often initial API attempts failed and had to be retried. Frequent retries may indicate transient instability in the integration or TT system.

description: Indicates the number of retried API calls that succeeded for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: A high value here (relative to RetryCalls) shows that retries are effectively overcoming temporary issues, though persistent reliance on retries still suggests underlying reliability problems.

description: Indicates the number of retried API calls that failed for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: These are calls that continued to fail even after retry, indicating more serious or sustained issues that prevent ticket operations from completing successfully.

description: Indicates the number of dead tickets for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Dead tickets correspond to retried API calls that still failed after the maximum retry attempts. They represent tickets whose creation or update could not be completed and require manual investigation; detailed diagnosis provides more information about them.

description: Indicates the total number of alerts added to the eG manager from alarm history for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Represents the number of alert records brought into the manager for potential ticketing, forming the input workload to the integration.

description: Indicates the total number of alerts processed for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Shows how many alerts were actually handled (for example, mapped to tickets or evaluated) by the integration logic during the period.

description: Indicates the total number of alerts sent to the TT system for this organization during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Represents how many alerts resulted in outbound communication to the TT system, indicating the effective volume of ticket‑related activity driven by monitoring alerts.
